text:
<The Weight of Evidence>

<tense discussion among friends, dim room>
<anxiety hangs in the air>
Razumihin: “The bodies were warm when found! Warm!”  

Razumihin: “How could they act so childish?”  

Razumihin: “Witnesses saw them laughing, right after!”  

---  

<frustration mounts, the stakes are high>
<impending doom felt by all>
Speaker: “But the earrings were found with Nikolay!”  

Speaker: “It’s strange! But we need more proof!”  

Speaker: “Our legal system won’t care about the truth!”

**PAGE SUMMARY:** The discussion revolves around the circumstantial evidence against Nikolay, questioning the psychological plausibility of his guilt despite the presence of incriminating items.
